p: Rainfall, on the other hand, influence dengue occurrence by expanding the available breeding grounds. It fills containers and depressions where dengue vectors can breed from [ 15] and varies humidity levels. The ideal breeding habitats for dengue vectors (e.g. Ae. aegypti) include uncovered water containers, drainage systems, disposed plastic containers, or used tyres [ 1]. It is also expected that poor drainage canals in peri-urban areas may serve as reliable mosquito breeding grounds and floods that develop after rainfall act as additional breeding sites that amplify mosquito numbers.
